Pre-Game Insights: Iceland kicked off their UEFA Nations League campaign with a home game against Montenegro.
Iceland recently beat star-studded England in a June friendly.
Netherlands proved to be a challenge for Iceland at De Kuip.
Hakon Haraldsson, a talented midfielder from Lille, is an important player for Iceland.
Andri Gudjohnsen, a Gent attacker, is also notable for Iceland.
Montenegro suffered a 3-1 loss to Georgia in their last warm-up game.
Stefan Savic and Stevan Jovetic are key players for Montenegro.
Montenegro is not regarded as a good traveler.
In a previous friendly, Montenegro defeated Iceland 2-1 in 2021, making Iceland eager for revenge.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Iceland had little to no success during the first 60 years of entering FIFA competitions, failing to qualify for a single major tournament in that period.
The team then made tremendous progress at the start of the 21st century, reaching Euro 2016 and performing impressively.
Players like Gylfi Sigurdsson, Aron Gunnarsson, Kolbeinn Sigthorsson, and Emil Hallfredsson were part of a successful generation.
Eidur Gudjohnsen became the first Icelandic footballer to play for top European sides.
